blow out.translation[0].definitions[0].d: if you blow a flame or a fire out, or if it blows out, it stops burning
blow out.translation[0].definitions[0].e: The match blew out in the wind.
blow out.translation[0].definitions[1].d: if a tyre blows out, it bursts
blow out.translation[0].definitions[2].d: if a storm blows itself out, it ends
blow out.translation[0].definitions[3].d: to kill yourself, or someone else, with a shot to the head
blow out.translation[0].definitions[5].d: if you blow out your knee or another joint in your body, or if it blows out, you injure it badly
blow out.translation[0].definitions[6].d: if an oil or gas well blows out, oil or gas suddenly escapes from it
blow out.translation[0].definitions[7].d: to stop having a friendship or relationship with someone
